location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:70 x 96 mmCondition:The image is in good condition.Foliation:'b'; '12'Process:Silver gelatin print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This image shows a group of men and boys standing and sitting on or behind a local boat known as a ‘shasha’, made from the central stalks of palm fronds (barusti) bundled together.Inscriptions:Lower left, below image, in pen: ‘Mathra.’Lower right, below image, in pen: ‘Country Boat'Upper left, above image, in pencil, crossed-out: ‘b’Lower right, alongside image, in pencil: ‘12’Lower right, below image, in pen: ‘(Jan. 1918)’
